climbs.name: Ron's Tower - Standard Route
climbs.fa: Steve Anderton, Mike Colacino, Bill Duncan

content.description:
FA on Thanksgiving Day, 1996.  Climb up to the top of the bedding seam and a nice ledge. 5.8  Continue up the crack (5.9) until it turns into a thin hands/finger crack (5.9) and becomes vertical.  Continue up to the chimney and the summit.  This will likely go free at 5.11 or a more difficult rating.  I think the FA party might have had a wee hangover.

Avoid the loose rocks immediately to the right of the base of this route.  The middle tower looks inviting, but a thorough recon did not yield any routes sans a bolt ladder.
content.location: Ron's Tower is the westernmost or right-hand tower.  The FA route ascends the crack on the south side (back side) of the tower.

content.description: This route ascends the right hand crack system on the north face of the tower.  The left hand crack is wide and appears to have been climbed (gear visible), but no information is known.
content.location: Ron's Tower is the western most or right hand tower of the group.

content.description: This route ascends the obvious crack on the north face of the tower.
content.protection: Standard desert rack, plus 6 cam hooks for the soft stone, and a few pins, 2 bird beaks.
content.location: This is the eastern most or left hand tower of the group.
